references: how women need to be a part of the post-Brexit conversation
issues like childcare, closing the pay gap
legislation that came about because of the EU to improve the lives of women

justifications: Sophie Walker, current leader of the UK's Women's Equality Party, wrote a piece for The Telegraph about how women need to be a part of the post-Brexit conversation.

Sophie Walker says that issues like childcare, closing the pay gap, and the UK ratifying the pan-European Istanbul Convention to end violence against women and girls have to be a part of the conversation moving forward.
Sophie Walker expresses concern about legislation that came about because of the EU to improve the lives of women.

references: legislation prompted by membership of the EU that - while creaky in places - has done much to enhance the lives of women workers

justifications: Sophie Walker expresses concern about legislation that came about because of the EU to improve the lives of women.

references: women's major contribution to the EU debate so far has been to say that more women should contribute to the EU debate

justifications: Helen Lewis said that '[I]f you were feeling waspish, you might conclude that women's major contribution to the EU debate so far has been to say that more women should contribute to the EU debate.'
Sophie Walker, current leader of the UK's Women's Equality Party, wrote a piece for The Telegraph about how women need to be a part of the post-Brexit conversation.
Helen Lewis said that '[I]f you were feeling waspish, you might conclude that women's major contribution to the EU debate so far has been to say that more women should contribute to the EU debate.'
Jo Cox was tragically killed by a man who screamed 'Britain first,' apparently targeting her because of her liberal stance on immigration and her desire for the UK to remain a part of the EU.

The Guardian's Helen Lewis said that '[I]f you were feeling waspish, you might conclude that women's major contribution to the EU debate so far has been to say that more women should contribute to the EU debate.'
